free_text.Learning outcomes: To convey theoretical and practical aspects of current strategies for  functional genomic analyses. The course will use a combination of formal lectures, journal article discussion  and group and individual problem-solving for this instruction.
free_text.Content: 1) Genome organization[br/]2) Chromatin structure[br/]3) Quantitative functional genomics[br/]4) Expression analysis[br/]5) Molecular interaction networks[br/]6) Biological pathway analysis[br/]7) Bioinformatic approaches to understanding genome function[br/]
free_text.Note: This course requires a minimum of 10 participants and a maximum of 20.
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Cell biology (basic level), Molecular biology (basic level)
